[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: bytecode_instruction_costs()] [Cost Asymmetry] MoveFrom has 459 instruction_gas while MoveFromGeneric has only 13. Can this asymmetry be exploited? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: bytecode_instruction_costs()] [Ret Instruction] Ret costs 638 gas, much higher than other instructions. Is this cost accurate for security? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: bytecode_instruction_costs()] [Call Instructions] Call costs 1132 while CallGeneric costs 582. Can attackers prefer one over the other for gas optimization exploits? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: bytecode_instruction_costs()] [Vec Operations] VecMutBorrow (1902) costs much more than VecImmBorrow (1334). Can this difference enable gas arbitrage? (Low)
[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: bytecode_instruction_costs()] [Exists Operations] Exists costs 41 vs ExistsGeneric costs 34. Why are generics cheaper? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: bytecode_instruction_costs()] [Negate Instruction] Negate has 0 instruction_gas. Can attackers use negate operations for free? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: bytecode_instruction_costs()] [Memory Gas Uniformity] All instructions have memory_gas=1. Is this uniform cost appropriate for all operations? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Static: INITIAL_COST_SCHEDULE] [Lazy Race] Lazy static initialization. Can multiple threads cause race conditions during first access? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Static: INITIAL_COST_SCHEDULE] [Sorting Requirement] Instructions are sorted before table creation. Can incorrect sorting cause wrong cost lookups? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Constant: CONST_SIZE] [Size Assumption] CONST_SIZE=16 bytes for non-string constants. Can larger constant types bypass this assumption? (Medium)
[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Constant: REFERENCE_SIZE] [Reference Size] REFERENCE_SIZE=8 bytes. On 32-bit systems or with fat pointers, is this accurate? (Low)
[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Constant: STRUCT_SIZE] [Struct Overhead] STRUCT_SIZE=2 bytes seems very small. Can large structs be severely undercharged? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Constant: MIN_EXISTS_DATA_SIZE] [Exists Minimum] MIN_EXISTS_DATA_SIZE=100 bytes for non-existent data. Can attackers optimize exists checks around this threshold? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Trait: ToUnit] [Multiplier Overflow] MULTIPLIER=1000 for GasUnit to InternalGasUnit. Can conversion overflow with large gas values? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Type: Gas] [Type Alias] Gas is an alias for GasQuantity<GasUnit>. Can type confusion between Gas and InternalGas cause vulnerabilities? (Medium)
[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: remaining_gas()] [Round Down] Uses to_unit_round_down(). Can repeated conversions leak gas through rounding? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Cross-Function: Gas Accounting] [Determinism] Do all validators calculate identical gas costs for the same operations, or can subtle differences cause consensus failures? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Cross-Function: Memory Size] [Legacy Sizing] Multiple functions use legacy_abstract_memory_size(). Are modern Move types properly sized? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Cross-Function: Error Propagation] [Consistency] Do all gas charging errors propagate correctly, or can some be swallowed leading to free execution? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Cross-Function: Iterator Manipulation] [Length Attacks] Multiple functions use iterator.len(). Can attackers provide malicious iterators with false lengths? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Cross-Function: Concurrent Access] [Thread Safety] Is GasStatus thread-safe, or can parallel execution cause race conditions in gas accounting? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Cross-Function: Opcode Mapping] [Enum Safety] All opcode conversions assume valid enum values. Can invalid bytecode cause undefined behavior? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Cross-Function: Cost Table Updates] [Atomic Updates] When cost tables are updated, is the update atomic or can partial updates cause inconsistent states? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Module-Level: Serialization] [Serde Safety] CostTable and GasCost are Serializable. Can malicious serialized data bypass validation? (High)
[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Module-Level: Clone Safety] [Deep Copy] CostTable is Cloneable. Does cloning properly deep copy the instruction_table? (Medium)
